alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clay; Cloud; Dickinson; Geary; Jackson; Marshall; Morris; Nemaha; Ottawa; Pottawatomie; Republic; Riley; Wabaunsee; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 23 at 2:44PM CDT until August 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values reaching 104 to 115 degrees. * WHERE...All of central, north-central, northeast, and portions of east-central Kansas. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working outdoors or participating in outdoor activities, and those without access to quality air conditioning.
info.instruction: An Excessive Heat Warning means that a prolonged period of dangerously hot weather is expected, during which heat illnesses are likely. Postpone any non-essential outdoor activities during the midday and afternoon. Stay in an air-conditioned building and check up on relatives and neighbors. If you must venture outside, drink plenty of water, wear light and loose fitting clothing, and reduce strenuous activities. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 9 1 1. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
